author: raulj
content: It's all a matter of curiosity. Definitely learning languages such as Go or Rust can help a lot with understanding how some of algorithms in blockchain nodes are implemented. For Ethereum, a good idea is to try running an eth1 or eth2 node yourself and asking questions about the different components that power them. For example: "how does the chain sync?" or how is data stored, how does the p2p networking work, what are the APIs available to me, etc. Then, a place to start is by looking for good first issues in popular open source projects such as go-ethereum or others and communicating with the developers on what you can help with

content: And don't forget to have fun (:
